intro: Pileocalyx elegans, commonly known as the elegant pileocalyx, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, fluffy seed pods. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Pileocalyx elegans is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
